result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
11:01 AM - case called.  Defendant Clayton Walter Thomas Plautz appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney John Zich for Clayton Walter Thomas Plautz appeared in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin for State of Wisconsin appeared in court.  State has complied with victim rights.  Statement by Atty Zich - in receipt of complaint - waive reading.  Court notes a cash bond has already been set.  Atty Zich requests a signature bond.  Court questions  Defendant.  Response by Defendant.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding bond.  Court will convert the cash bond to a signature bond.  Atty Zich waives time  limits.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No contact with the victim or the victim's residence.  Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.

1:31 PM - case called.  Defendant Clayton Walter Thomas Plautz appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court questions Defendant. Responses by Defendant.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
